docs.snippet: Yachts from England, Uruguay, Argentina, Bermuda, Cuba, Canada and the Virgin Islands were among the 121 entries for the Newport-to-Bermuda race made public yesterday by Daniel D. Strohmeier, chairman of the sponsoring Cruising Club of America race...
docs.lead_paragraph: Yachts from England, Uruguay, Argentina, Bermuda, Cuba, Canada and the Virgin Islands were among the 121 entries for the Newport-to-Bermuda race made public yesterday by Daniel D. Strohmeier, chairman of the sponsoring Cruising Club of America race committee. The event will begin on June 14. The distance is 635 nautical miles.

headline.main: RECORD 121 CRAFT ENTERED FOR RACE; Foreign Yachts, Eight From Naval Academy Listed in Newport-Bermuda Test

docs.snippet: Vice President Nixon, returning to Washington last Thursday after the ordeal of his eighteen-day tour of Latin America, received a triumphant homecoming, but the evidence of widespread and violent anti-U. S. feeling disclosed by his trip remained --...
docs.lead_paragraph: Vice President Nixon, returning to Washington last Thursday after the ordeal of his eighteen-day tour of Latin America, received a triumphant homecoming, but the evidence of widespread and violent anti-U. S. feeling disclosed by his trip remained -- as did the related question of why the trip was made at all.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 19 -- Dr. Jose A. Mora of Uruguay began a regular ten-year term today as Secretary General of the Organization of American States. Dr. Mora was elected to continue in the post he has held since 1957, completing the term of Carlos...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 19 -- Dr. Jose A. Mora of Uruguay began a regular ten-year term today as Secretary General of the Organization of American States. Dr. Mora was elected to continue in the post he has held since 1957, completing the term of Carlos Davila of Chile, who died.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times
